page.title: 10 CREECH HILL NR BRUTON
page.content: Creech Hill lies to the north- west of Bruton and is one of the beauty spots in the area.It is a popular place for walking on a fresh and clear day.It is also a place of historic significance. On the top of the hill,one of the highest points in the area,during Roman times was sited a Romano-Celic temple and fort.One can easily understand the location because of the commanding position the hill has over the valleys around. Today it is just a large outcrop,set in hilly landscape,heavily wooded with no visible evidence of its past.The slopes of the hill are used for motor-cycle scrambling events,very popular in the area.The woods are also used by the local farmer as a breeding- ground for pheasants.
